review: This has been my go-to Fridays for about 10 years and boy oh boy has it changed. When I first starting coming here, it was pretty decent, including employees and service.  However, now it seems like management has been quite careless on the upkeep of this establishment.  Most employees are so unprofessional. ED however, whom is always up front- is always super nice and professional but the staff overall, are much younger in age than their past hires and so they seem to be careless and not very sensitive towards the needs of their customers.  Why 3 stars? Welp, luckily, 8 out of 10 times my ribs are awesome but I do have to agree with my fellow yelpers on this, this establishment needs help, c'mon guys you have the movie theater and Legacy Plaza up the street, something that the Norwood TGI Fridays (which is now closed) did not have! Location draws in more crowds, you must keep up!

One of the worst restaurant experience ever. I worked in the restaurant business before and eat out min of 4 nights per week.  Should have picked up the hint when the restaurant was more than 3/4 empty and I had to wait 15 minutes for a table on a Thursday night. They only had 2 servers on duty.  It took a while before she took our order.  My JD chix strips were dry and over cooked. Not fresh. Come on now- that is your signature dish.  Then after about an hour of ordering, my kids Mac & Cheese came with my wife's pasta. My kids are 5 and 3 yr old twins.  Her pasta was not even hot. It was like warm like it's been sitting out for a little bit.   The family finished their meal and my food was not even out yet. I told them to cancel it and my food comes out 20 minutes after everyone else. Reason I wanted to cancel is because it was now ten minutes before eight.  I got there at 6:15pm.  When I voiced my grievance with the supervisor and the waitress,  they could have cared less.  I would be embarrassed to work or manage this place with my experience I received.   Did not even notice the poor ratings till I went to do your review. Fridays is going downhill

Do not go there. I went there today and this is the letter I sent them....Dear Sir / Madam. I was at your restaurant as you can see today. The food and the service was terrible. Before I explain I want you to know I am not looking for anything for free. I just want you to know how bad the service is there. We ordered our meals. We got our appertisers with our meal not before it the server said "We have an issue with the cook" He gave us the food and left. He came back a few minutes later and we told him me wife's meal was not what she ordered. He said "That's on me I made the mistake" One of the ladies asked him for salad dressing he said OK. He left and did not come back. She never got the salad dressing. The fellow with us ordered the sandwich with the ajus sauce for dipping. The dipping sauce was onion soup. When the server did come back he said "Oh I forgot you salad dressing my fault" We told him about the dipping sauce and he said that was the cooks fault not his. I mentioned about getting the appertisers the same time as the meal and her said " We are very busy and if I did not do it that way it would of taken an extra half hour" The place was almost empty and I told him that. Again he blamed it all on the cook. I would like a phone call please about this issue.  Thank you

Waiter came outside and threw food at the car and even threatened to get a gun and shoot us after not giving a good tip; not exaggerating. The waiters name was Dominique and after speaking with the manager Phil he thought it was a joke. After going back and talking with the manger AGAIN on the phone he said he was gonna look at the car, but 3 police cars later nothing had been resolved.  Hoping that these men get punished for there disrespectfulness. Also when we came back the other waiters were yelling at us saying we broke glasses and flipped tables which is false.

Poor customer service! Never enough staff whenever I come to this place! There is always a long wait when the place is not busy at all, lots of tables and there is still at least a 20 minute wait. Not worth coming here!

Stopped in for Friday night drinks. Sat at the bar. Maybe 12 people total 3 people tending the bar.  Service was terrible.  Took 5 mins just to give me a menu and xlean off the table.  Ordered the new Mai Tai nothing like the picture (no pineapple or cherry garnish like advertised)  Table sticky disgusting  Food was luke warm. The boneless buffalo wings looked awful. Almost as if they just threw Frank's hot sauce on the.  The bar keeps were just laughing and having a good old time. Forgetting other peoples orders.  I have ALWAYS had a good time at Fridays. I will never come back to this 1 EVER

Took my family to go eat today evening 1-14-2018. Took a hour to get our food. The forks and knifes were dirty and smelled. The only set that clean was our daughters. When we finally got our food it was barely warm. My fries was straight cold. Even though the restaurant was half empty between between 5 and 6. Their credit card machine was broken also so thx god I had cash. The food sucked  balls. I wasn't gonna leave a tip but my wife said it wasn't the waiters fault and it's true but I was still pissed. So I left him the 20% tip. This TGI Fridays sucks monkey balls. It was also half empty so I asked if we could get a closer booth to the t.v so we can watch the Saints and Vikings game since it's NFL PLAYOFFS and the charge person who sat us down said no even though they were half empty. If not for my wife I would have cursed that motherfucker out. I'll never go to that TGI Friday's again. The only decent one is the one in Brigham circle. Fuck this place

I dont even know when to begin. Lets start with the service, as soon as we walked in it was a complete mess. Floors were dirty, the wait staff was grumpy and rude. Especially for a Saturday i was really shocked. Hardly anyone was there and it was still a disaster. The bathroom was atrocious! I wouldnt let my worst enemy be caught dead in that bathroom. Genuinely disgusting. I dont even like doing reviews but after this expirience i was compelled too. The food was very sub par. My girlfriends chicken was partially undercooked and rubbery and my "boneless chicken fingers" was partially freezer burned. I mean really? Wtf?!?!... I will never, ever! Come back to this nasty place again. Even People from poverty stricken areas would take one look at this place and would rather stay hungry. Aweful. Just aweful.....

The Cajun Shrimp & Chicken Pasta at TGIF is delicious. The three times I've had it, it didn't disappoint. I also tasted the fried shrimp and fries from one of my dinner guest. Pass on that. But the chicken tenders were good. The sweet potato fries were good too. I didn't try the ribs, but other dinner guest said they didn't fall off the bone, but were tasty. Now that I got that out the way, DO NOT go to the Dedham MA TGIF. Our party had to ask for a waiter and for someone to take our drink order. That was 1/2 hour after being sat. An hour until our food came. They are slow. AND it's filthy. The floor was sticky. Our table...I had to ask a worker to wipe down from previous guest. I pulled my chair in and something sticky was on my left hand. Finally, there was a dirt stain that got on my skirt that either came from leaning against sink to wash my hands of leaning against table to cut a cake we brought. The darkness isn't for ambience. It's to hide the stains..

Recently dined here and I just felt uneasy about my meal after a couple things went happened. To start off, our cups were dirty. The bartender told us she would take care of it, she was really polite. This review isn't about the service because the service itself was good. My concern was over sanitary conditions. I mean it's not like they hand scrub the cups, so even when a new cup was brought to us,  they were dirty as well. The cups get dunked between 3 sink basins to "ensure" cleanliness but that was far from the case. Next, I noticed an employee pouring a new batch of ice into the bucket. Okay cool. But then she used her own bare hands to push the ice cubes to make room for more ice. Now I'm not sure where your hands have been, but I sure don't want them on my ice cubes if you're pouring me a cup to drink.  I'm not even going to really touch base on the food since there's not much to comment on skimp-the-sauce wings

This fucking place sucks  The managers and servers  This place should be shut down.  They should get donald trump down herw and fire!!!! Everybody. So maybe they can learn to appreciate a job. They get paid based on the clientele if no one comes in then no one makes money right!  These people need to go and place should be shut down,till the proper team is in  Place and actually do a great job. People get tooo  comfortable,some change would only be a plus for this shit of a place. Fridays in dedham ma.

Our waitress was very moody and had an attitude,my father asked "can i have" "IL GET IT." She completely abandoned us. The manager had to be our sever half the time. Then she came over and "apologized" then said "OK". I didn't except that apology at all. My food came out wrong then i almost didn't eat . And remember the waitress is still not even near us when she should have been. 2 star and 4 dollar tip no! 10 dollars to the manger! He gave us our meals free!

I was solely here for the PPV UFC 201. Finally a spot near my friend's place to watch pay-per-view fights! I was super stoked! However, there were 2 huge disappointments tonight 1) Woodley's right hand knocked out Lawler 2) the draughts here were disgustingly flat! I mentioned it to the bartender and he poured himself a glass and agreed. So he handed us a menu for the bottled beer list. Are they planning to do anything about it? Even though our bartender was nice, I'm not a big fan of their carelessness regarding the flat beer problem.

Truly one of the filthiest and poorly run TGIF I have ever had the displeasure being in.  The floors were dirty from the night before when the doors opened.  The menus were filthy with food stained fingerprints from over months or years.  The silverware was dirty and the knife handles were actually cracked and broken, ready for the trash.   There table we sat at was left dirty.  There was some kind of bug crawling on the table that I had to smash.   The waitress didn't seem to know anything about the menu at all.  No idea what was on draft and then made excuses rather than find out.  She seem annoyed that I wanted to know.  She had no idea what the menu items came with or how they were prepared.  I would say she was new, but it didn't seem that way at all.  No one here cares, so why should we?    There were not many people here and now I know why.  Manner doesn't care about this place, so don't waste your time or money.  This place is filthy and poorly run even for a TGIF.

HORRIBLE!!!!!!! DISGUSTING!!!!!  Got here at 5:30 on a Saturday night for a QUICK bite to eat & cocktails.. Parking lot had maybe 20 cars..... we walked into a ZOO! 45+ wait for 2 people as they claimed they were "short staffed".... Funny because when I went to use the bathroom I saw 3 waitresses SITTING IN A BOOTH TALKING!!! WTF!?    Ended up siting at the bar & the lady was nice but she mentioned her shift just started & apologized for the mess.... Fast forward- Food was UNDER cooked , SLOW service. Should have ordered 2 of everything in the first place because they were sooooo slow! NOT happy! I'm NOT a "Fridays" person really NOT a chain restaurant person but we wanted a drink & snack before dinner in Boston... Now I'm filled with beer, UNDER cooked appetizers & am made we stopped & wasted our time & money. WHAT A DUMP! ITS A SHAME BECAUSE PEOPLE WILL NOT TIP PROPERLY DUE TO THEM BEING "SHORT STAFFED"  which isn't fair to the bartender who waited on us & the food runner but hey isn't this why there should be a MANAGER ON DUTY??? HELLO MANAGER, PLEASE CONTACT ME AND I WILL SHOW YOU HOW TO RUN A BUSINESS!!!!!! PERFECT EXAMPLE OF WHY I LOATHE CHAIN RESTAURANTS NEVER AGAIN

The place was not busy at all. We waited at least 40min for our food. Apparently there was serious drama within the staff yelling, etc. I felt extremely bad for our waitress who was a middle aged kind lady who was being treated like CRAP from her colleagues. I can not support this establishment the staff was unprofessional!

The food and ambience was Amazing considering we had kids with us , But the 1 star os for waitress she was very lazy on her job, I had to fetch her twice just to let her know we were ready to cash out on top of that we were waiting for her for 15-20 minutes before I decided to go find her.  SMH she ruined her tip I ALREADY HAVE TO CHASE AFTER A 1&3 YEAR OLD I DON'T WANT TO CHASE AFTER A DAMN WAITRESS TOO!!!
Can I give negative stars? If so, I would. Poor service, filthy, over greased burgers. Ever again.

Went out to eat with my kids and my mother on a Friday night. We were seated in the bar area and the smell was horrible it smelt like mold. My kids were insistent that we stay so I thought maybe it was just me. Then we ordered and while waiting for our food my mother watch a waitress drop the nozzle (that attaches when you pour the drinks) on the floor bounced a few times she looked around to see if anyone noticed picked it up and used it without cleaning it. Disgusting. Then our food came my mother ordered her burger well done and at best it was medium rare and she didn't want to order anything else since we had waited close to an hour for our food to come. My daughter got chicken fingers that were too hard to even eat. Do not eat here.  The waitress was wonderful an apologetic! I left her a note to make sure she knew it wasn't her we were upset with.

While the staff was incredibly nice and friendly, just as we got our food our server told us about a giant fruit fly problem the restaurant had had the previous night. Maybe not the best thing to tell your customers.

The food was ok, the service sucked. It was 10 minutes before we even got asked if we wanted a drink. Then our Server was MIA for the rest of the meal. This place use to be good, but its gone DOWN HILL!!!!!

Saturday night and the place is practically empty, and now I know why.  The food was terrible. I mean really really bad, and it took forever to get to us. We had burgers, endless apps, and an entree. Some was undercooked. Some was cold. None was as it should have been.  Very disappointing.

We went in last night for a drink and some food. Emma was our bartender and she was awesome. Came right over, friendly, and smiling. Got our drinks quick and the food came out fast and hot-which was delish!

Here at Fridays with my kids.Its empty yet we waiting twenty minutes to be seated.Know one even acknowledged that we were standing there.I don't understand how you could not have anyone up front seating people.Ridic

Service was fucking horrible , waiting 45 minutes  waiting and got cold food , waitress name rachelle was the worst, managers are lifting tables because their aint enough for big parties . Waitress waiting like 4 tables at one time, complete shit show

Terrible customer service. We arrived at 3:00 pm on a sunday night. We were told that we would have our table in 20 minutes, but i was way longer. Not only that but we wouldn't get our food for a very long time. All the waiters did was stand in the kitchen and laugh. Very slow service, would not recommend.

We love fridays . We visit there often. We came in on Wednesday night and had a horrible experience. We walked in and it wasn't crowded with no one at the door we sat ourselves and so did the three patrons behind us. After sitting at the bar, with 5 other people it took the bartender about 10 mins to reach us. After my friend had ordered ( while I was in the bathroom) and wanted a full rack of ribs with his steak and  other half rack was offered as an add on she told my friend he had to order two meals. So we ordered our appetizers and drinks( which looked and tasted like syrup and juice) our appetizer came out. We had no side plates or utensils. And we sat there patiently for 8 minutes while our food had gotten cold. And the same bartender who argued that she worked there 16 years and couldn't get us a full rack of ribs passed us by twice!!! Horrible experience!!! I won't be back we then went to fridays yesterday ( thursday) in Framingham. Ordered the same exact thing. And was happily obliged. Service was great in Framingham!! And we got our side plates before our food!!!

Horrible horrible horrible what else can I say we literally had to come and seat ourselves how convenient for me. I'm not mad I'm just disappointed. Our waiter was awesome though her name was nay. I always come to this Friday because the one in Boston is wak but it took them long to greet us but then again we did come at 12 o'clock so I don't care im still getting my drink and half on my meal lol bye

Place was a mess . The wait was long for no reason ... Oh wait , none of the tables were cleaned smh !!! One of the host that was supposed to sit us wasn't even at the door . Wish I would've gotten his name, but I was to annoyed too . He was this light skin African American male . He wasn't doing his job at all . Food was mediocre. Wasn't as good or the portions was a big as when I went a month before this time (which is why I came back this time, which I shouldn't have). I wouldn't recommend this Friday Franchise to anyone . I posted pics of how dirty the place was

Never going back to this Friday's, the only reason why I'm giving one star is because I have to choose at least a start in order to post a review. The service was terrible and the food was a borderline health hazard. The table and chairs presented like a safety risk, wobbling back and forth. The legs were uneven and I almost fell out of my chair. The food was disgusting. The environment was overall bad, I felt like I was going to get robbed by every person that walked through the door, including the wait staff. This area has turned for the worst since Legacy Place was built.

Going to this Friday's is like gambling its 50/50 chance that you may get good service and may also get good food.  It can be the middle of afternoon and service is most of the time extremely slow.  Sometimes the food is great then other times I order the same food and forget it is like it was made with different ingredients and thrown in the microwave to beat up.  Wish it was better cause is not bad when they get their act together.

The common problem with ALL TGI Fridays is that they close down around 1130-12 way before their actual closing time. This Friday's is no exception. When I get out of work late, I know the rules, I might not get to a restaurant in time for a last call beer, but this TGI was awful.  The staff on Saturday June 11 was absolutely horrible to my girlfriend and I. The door was locked before we got there at 12:30am but we slipped in after a nice guy let us in. Just looking for a quick bite, a small app, a coke, whatever they had available. But not one of the four workers at the bar would even make eye contact with us, though we sat right by one. He only continued to dry glasses and intentionally look away. No hello, not even a 'sorry we're closing now because we all want to leave early' but a deliberate cold shoulder. We sat there embarrassed for 10 minutes before I realized they were not going to acknowledge us at all. I am beyond upset and will actively discourage our friends from going to this establishment.

Normally I choose to visit the Fridays in Randolph or Braintree but decided to try the dedham MA version. Needless to say this will be the last time.  The restaurants biggest downfall is its staff. While all may not be worthy of a two star, they are bogged down by the ones I witnessed. First, the young lady who ran the searing decided to take a bathroom break which lasted 15 mins- and caused a line to pile up at the door. I was forced to walk to the kitchen to ask if anyone was taking seating.... A substitute scrambled to the front, never apologized, and just proceeded to seat people.  Location: you can feel the dirt on the floor and the stickiness of the tables. Food- good. If you want to go to Friday's try Braintree or Randolph!

I use to go to TGI Fridays all the time with my father when I was little and I loved it -- when you're a kid you are very low maintenance but I loved the décor and we always seemed to have a good time and a good meal when we would go there. As I grew up and now live near TGI Fridays I have decided to give it a try on a few occasions and I can say it has gone downhill. We got our appetizer the same time as our entrée which makes no sense! Either way one plate of food is going to get cold which it does and you are then left with a cold plate of wasted money! I should've learned my lesson but I went a few days ago with my boyfriend and we decided to share an appetizer and entrée  and of course it was brought out at the same time luke warm. Tasted like the mashed potato's were the instant mashed that you find at the food store. The steak was not made Med-Rare it was over cooked. And the ribs were semi good but we weren't given enough napkins as every place should know that ribs get messy. It also took our waitress about 20 mins to get us water and then another hour or so to refill our water! My drink was just awful it was very sour and disappointing. We decided to get the brownie obsession which we always would get and when it came out and was smaller than the size of my fist it made me very unhappy. Overall it was a very disappointing "date night" left me hungry feeling like I wasted money and time. After writing this review I hope you can save yourself and not waste money. Save the money for somewhere better like Halfway Café in Dedham or Hibachi in Norwood.  TGI Fridays doesn't even deserve a star from me -- If I could give them zero stars I would. So if you want low class dining with screaming children and bad service and horrible food by all means please pick TGI Fridays in Dedham.

Came here for dinner with my fiancé and son and requested a high chair which was completely filthy. It had dried up macaroni, sauce, and all kinds of gunk all over it. Mentioned it to the hostess who sat us down, and she was nice enough to clean it for us. But that was nothing compared to the fingernail I found floating in my drink later on. To make matters worse, I was already half way through my drink and the nail looked like it had fungus. Beyond disgusting and disturbing. I don't know how I didn't end up throwing up, but I definitely ended up nauseous and lost my appetite. So disappointing. The waiter went to get the manager who said I didn't have to pay for my food or drink. Wish he would have also been more sincere with his apologies. The star only counts for the waiter who was nice. Although my fiancé asked for a second drink which he never brought. But whatever. Never going back.

This place is only good for the bar specials. 4 dollar Long Island iced teas, 5 dollar wings, 3 dollar drafts. Just don't leave for more than 15 minutes or the bartenders will throw away your stuff and give your seats to other people because they assume you walked out on the tab. I offered to leave my card, put it in my tab cup, and came back once to find it on my table for anyone to take. They gave me the wrong sauce for my wings, offered to fix it, and brought back the same wings with the new sauce. They literally made me wait 10 minutes to make me think they made new wings.  If you come here with any expectations at all, come with low ones.  TL;DR cheap drinks at the bar with cheap bar food and underwhelming service.

Because I can't do zero stars :(  The host used a paper tab to not only take names (always done when there's a wait) and took strangely quite the time to sit a family of four before us and ourselves -- the place was barely 1/8 filled?  The server.. I cannot even. Spent more time on my phone waiting on her to come around than I do in other restaurants, even when they're filled. Finished off a Mudslide and house salad before she came with the entrees; was asked if I wanted another drink, which I asked if I could switch to the Blue Rita Shaker. That moment when your table is pretty much done and the time that the server comes around to see if you need anything else before serving your check (more or less an hour after we got seated).... that's when I got the Rita. There was no 'upbeat' attitude, no upselling, no check-ups from the server. Just came around to serve things. Food was overall good. For some reason, my black bean burger kind of fell apart like a sad Burger King Whopper with the avocado slipping out like a mad fish the entire time and bean beads gathering on the plate like a very loose 'burger'. Fries, regular or sweet potato, are always awesome at any Fridays. I think I'll stick with my home surroundings and stay with Milford from now on though.

decent food very poor service from our waitress jamilynn too forever to get our drinks and food ans well it is un professional to have you cell pbone in your hand the entire time your waiting on a customer.  i do not recomend eating here and i will mecer visit this place again.
Our waiter was good, but overall service from others was bad because of loss or mistaken orders. The food itself was also very hit and miss, with a lot of stuff being bland and flavorless.

This was the worst experience I've ever had at any restaurant! Over an hour wait for food. Food was cold, buns were hard, burgers were like bricks, messed up my mothers order, the list goes on. Absolutely horrible food & service! Save yourself the trip and never go here!

I would have having it a no stars but it's not an opinion.if you are reading this and are about to go eat in there don't turn around this place is the worst the food taste like it just came out of the freezer put it in the microwave and then served it. We order some potato skin and the cheese tasted like deli cheese. The serve looked like she was high I can go on on but did I say don't ever , ever , ever come here.. The worst place ever don't ever ever ever ever ever ever ever never come here......

This is definitely one of the better TGI Fridays locations in the greater Boston area. Even though the one out in Milford is considerably better, basically none of the other TGI Fridays compare to the staff, service, and policies of the Dedham location. This location consistently allows me to use more than 1 coupon, and consistently gets my order correct. I felt the need to update this review, as I visited the Braintree TGI Fridays just a few days ago, where they did not go by my order specifications of one PLAIN cheeseburger, while they put everything on it. Then I had to order one from here (I wouldn't have drove back out there......), and it was correct and much more convenient (I live about 10 minutes away). Anyway, they definitely need a renovation, but I'd rather be able to use more than one coupon, have it conveniently located, with great staff (Manager Vicky and Waitress Brianna are both amazing), and great food (that is made right, unlike the Braintree location). Now, when will the Town Of Dedham approve those papers for this restaurant to be rebuilt................ Hopefully, ASAP!
Everytime I come here as busy as it appears I seem to sit right away which is never a bad thing...  Service is ok... Nothing spectacular, but nothing bad either!

The place was fairly empty....maybe three people at the bar and three tables, including mine. Why was there NO staff member to be found. Sat myself in the bar area and WAITED...AND WAITED...for my server. She strolls up nonchalant...no pep in her step. We order..it comes...but until the check came....did not see the server. A hum drum experience. The place has gone down hill. The service stunk.

This weekend while some family members were having a bridal shower in the area, we decided to stop in at TGI Fridays to watch the Brazil FIFA game and grab some drinks. When we dropped into the restaurant it was empty so we decided to eat at the bar. When we sat down we were greeted by the bartender Sergio who was really polite and took care of us during the time we were there. Throughout the game he checked in on us often and made sure that we had plenty of food and booze. He was also knowledgeable about the games and held a great conversation. Watching the game itself was great because they have a ton of televisions around the bar.  In the end the food was great and the service was even better. We had a blast watching the game and will be back to grab some brews in the future.

Stopped in for a late lunch after dealing with a mobile phone issue at a store nearby. I'm not a casual sitdown chain restaurant regular, but TGIF's commercials sucked me in for a burger. What I saw and experienced is similar to other Yelpers: slow service despite being nearly empty; a few hardcore patrons at the bar knocking back drinks in the middle of the day; a server who didn't know the menu and couldn't tell me how many ounces were in a small beer (and who first amused me, then annoyed the hell out of me, by constantly saying "hey, hey, hey" like a female Fat Albert (those under 35, Google it); seriously lacking food.  My Spicy Craft Beer Cheeseburger (~$10.50, as I recall) arrived 25 minutes after ordering - again, the place was dead and it was 2:30 p.m., well after lunch rush (assuming they even get one). It was not worth the wait. The charred patty was far past the medium I asked for and the size of one patty on the $1.39 McDouble, but Mickey D's value menu burger tastes good. I did like the fries, but that's not enough to bring me back. Neither is the $8 appetizer credit I got for completing their online survey.  Let me know what you think of this review by clicking a button below.

Stopped in for dinner for two of us they said 15 mins while waiting and looking around counted 13 empty tables and a waiting area full of people. Finally started seating people so we waited while waiting watched people walk in and get seated right away we waited 20 mins and that was the last straw walked out

So I've been here 15 minutes and only been offered a drink. The barkeep whose supposed to be taking care of everyone around the bar (which is only 3 ppl, who aren't btw in need of anything because they've been taken care of). I finally get her attention after several attempts, not once did she look my way while she was "busy" giving someone who just came to the bar her undivided attention. Idk if her speciality is only giving her undivided attention to men but if that's the case, this shouldn't be her place of employment. Now she seems very friendly, however, because of her negligence  I don't think I'll come to this Friday's ever again Now I placed my order for both app & dinner at the same time so I won't wait long. I  got the app after 15 minutes and an additional 15 minutes has passed and I've yet gotten my dinner, I just don't understand, it's not busy at all. After an additional 15 minutes I decided to leave and go home starving. Now the manager comp me for the app and I only ended up paying for my drink but honestly, I'd still never step foot at this Friday's again

Fridays is a decent Resturant in terms the atmosphere an Décor but the food was horrible the cheese was burnt on my plate the chicken was dry an chewy I couldn't finish it, the silverware was cloudy an didn't look clean..I had to ask for plastic, the waitress was okay but the overall experience wasn't pleasant, I wouldn't return to dine there again.

I really enjoyed my late night dinner here thanks to the best server ever, Brianna. Atmosphere: 3.5 Comfortable booths but they have a lot of artwork that has drink mixes on them and you can't read them. Annoying. Food: 4.5 Parmesan Crusted Chicken was delicious but needed a little bit more seasoning. Sizzling Chicken &Shrimp Plate was amazing, as well as the Spinach something dip appetizer. They did not have many choices for dessert. :( Drinks: 5 They have a ton of options and I went for the Pink Punk...something which comes with REAL COTTON CANDY. Most delicious drink ever. Service: 10 Brianna was the best waitress I've ever had. They were about to close, and instead of being grumpy or in a bad mood, she was extremely upbeat, helped with recommendations, always checked to see how we were doing (not in an obnoxious way but every time we needed something she was there). She was extremely fun to have and I hope to return here again just because of the awesome service she provided!

Dirty , Dirty , Dirty!!!!! By far this is the worst Fridays that I've been to. First off the place is a mess. I notice as soon as I walked in the floor was dirty. Then my wife went to the bathroom and it was feces in the toilet, smelled like a pig stye, and the floor was a mess. To top things off the food was cold and our glasses were dirty and loaded with food particles . The manager did try his best to help and comped the bill but I will never go there again. Please beware !!!!!  Sorry I forgot to post pics

I went this past Saturday around 11pm for pickup and the food was horrible. I got two orders of the Cajun pasta and a side order of fries for me and my bf,one of their popular dishes. One like normal and the other with penne pasta. There was barely any flavoring, the noodles were dry and naked, and everything sat in oil. This was my second time getting food from this location only because I was in the area. The best one is the Braintree location, which I'm lucky to be 15 minutes away from! Hallelujah
Not a great experience.  Poor service, food wasn't good and not the cleanest.

I went here Sunday with my brother & his girlfriend for dinner.  I was NOT impressed in the least!!  My brother suggested TGI Fridays bc of the "unlimited appetizers " there are only "certain" appetizers to choose from in this promotion.....WOOPIE...... No thanks!!  I can only eat so many potato skins or chicken wings!! I ordered the Jack Daniels burger med rare w sweet potato fries. The fries were great , the portion could have been a little better but the burger was cooked to the point of being used in a hockey game!! There was NO sauce too!! I sent it back & a decent one was replaced within 10 minutes. This one actually had the Jack Daniels sauce that was supposed to come with it in the 1st place!! My company had to watch me eat since they were done already.  I'm not sure if there is a shortage of ice at this location but all our drinks were warm & we had to request an additional cup of ice.  When the check arrived to my surprise I was charged for the hockey puck as well as the burger I ate!!   NOT COOL!!  I can't see me returning to this location again!!!  Thanks but no thanks!!

Hi, my name is Freddy. Today I'll be sharing my favorite place to eat. It is FRIDAY'S because of the big, juicy burgers. What's in them is bacon, hot melted cheese, and lots of meat. The mozzerella sticks have the  cheesey long cheese inside and the french-fries are cheesy too. The chocolate milk is soo cold like a wave of water. They also have TV's with sports like soccer, football, basektball, and baseball. The pizza there is soo cheesy that your brain might EXPLODE! You should go TGIFRIDAY'S because it's the greatest, awesomest place in the whole entire world!

Store # 0716 in Dedham, MA server#330 Sergio.   This was the worst service I have ever had.  Our server started well and was pleasant but he then completely ignored my friend and I.  After giving us water it took almost 30 minutes for him to acknowledge us and take our order.  We tried to not only order alcoholic drinks but our appetizers as well but he completely walked away.   After another 15 minutes I flagged the other bartender who said she would help but continued to do what she was doing and then other tasks.     Our server Sergio then came over and seemed to have an attitude when asking what we wanted.    And he was only going to take our app order and again proceeded to walk away.    We had to forcibly say that we would might as well put in our entree order in now.   It was at least  another 20 -30 minutes when a runner came out with our entrees.    We mentioned we never got our apps and the runner apologized saying it was his second day and  he would check on them.    We never got our apps.    Our server Sergio finally asks how our food was.    My friend informed him we never got our apps and he did apologize for that and took them off the bill. And offered a couple of app coupons for future visits.   Why would I want that.  I don't plan on visiting a TGI Friday anytime soon much less this one.    Oh and the food I had better in a frozen entree from the supermarket.  Bad all around.

Worst TGI Friday's I've ever been to. This is my 3rd and final attempt. The ONLY bright spot was my server Mai, who disarmed a very bad situation (I was sat and and waited 30 mins before I was acknowledged). By the end of my (lower than average) meal she had me laughing and enjoying my night. One of the best server's I've ever had. I hope they recognize and appreciate her hard work.

This is not base on the food. I went there Saturday afternoon, and we waited maybe 5 minutes. When they took us to our seats it was an uncomfortable table not a booth which me and the wife hate. So we asked for a booth and the hostess said they are short on people for service and that it will be a while before we can get a booth, I ask how long she said "undetermined time". So we sat down and we realize that these seats suck...so we left. Walking out I realize that hardly anyone had there food let alone drinks. So I was sure I made the right decision cuz it probably was going to be a while before I got my food.

I wish I could give zero stars, this place is awful top to bottom.  Myself and a friend went Saturday for some drinks, and were astonished when we asked the host about the bar top tables.  There was one open but still had some leftover plates and cups from the last people there.  We asked the host if we could sit there and he said "Well the table is dirty", and when we inquired about it being cleaned, he said to go find someone and ask them to clean it.  What a joke.  The bartenders were slow as hell, and seemed inconvenienced by having to serve anyone.  The owner and managers obviously do not care about this establishment....if I was the manager I would fire every bartender and host without thinking twice.  Next time I want microwaved crappy food I'll go to the frozen section of Shaws and probably get better service from the cashier.

I'm finally (sorta) outgrowing the whole chain restaurant thing, but every once in awhile, I get a "hankering". Decided to come here. Food wasn't anything memorable, but what was, was the MUSIC! This place was playing the BEST music I've heard in a restaurant in a loooong time. Also had a nice waiter.  Again, the music on 4/14/12 around 5:30p-6:30p was BLAZIN'! I'd come back here to eat, and bring friends just for the festive atmosphere!
Terribly slow service, over seasoned food, absent manager.  Skip it.  Really.
Endless appetizer deal is great, service was not. The french fries tasted old  and our waitress was very forgetful. This place is very unorganized
Horrible lunch service menu was terrible. Definitely not what I remember and food came cold and no flavor

Decent restaurant. Just your regular chain establishment with standard menu items. Nothing too special in the food area but you can't go wrong coming here either.  Services was great. Waitress was polite and friendly. Perfect amount of time between ordering our good, getting out appetizer and getting our main entrees. Good place to grab some dinner if you want to go somewhere near by or don't want to put to much thought into where to go. Don't come expecting some fancy pant dinner but you won't be let down either.
The service was slow and they overcooked my steak so much I had to send it back. It tasted like shoe leather. My kids were done eating before I started. Go somewhere else.
Been here you guys suck !!!! Horrible service!!!!! Never again will I ever come here 3 times & each time was HORRIBLE !!! Stoughton TGI is THE BEST !!!!!

I was here three times.  The last time I walked in and they admitted that due to staff shortage it was going to be slow.   This did not happen the first two times and my lunch almost made it to dinner.   Not worth the wait for average food and bad service.
Pretty awesome bar staff. Ive been here 20million times and never sat at an actual table. Always have an  exceptional time here since this is a dedham local fave.

One of my favorite place. Usually I get a drink at the bar and some lunch/dinner. My favorite plate: rib eye w/grill lobster. Unique. The bartender girls very professional and efficient. The manager quite friendly.

WORST WORST WORST SERVICE EVER!!! After church a group of us decided to go to Fridays Dedham. Once we got in this GRANDMA looking lady told us the wait time would be five minutes. This same woman proceeded to seat the people behind us. Mind you it was empty. Once we finally did get seated the hostess told us our waiter would be with us. Nobody ever showed up. We finally walked out. I would have given them a zero but that's not possible. I will not step foot in the Dedham Friday's again. I am thoroughly disappointed in the service.

We ate dinner here last night. The hostess was great, the waiter not so much! He was very unprofessional, awkward, and slow to attend to us when it was not very busy at all. Luckily our food was pretty good so overall our experience was okay.

The young lady who was out server was friendly-- so this really has nothing to do with our server, but with the food. We had two apps which were Ok-- although our BBQ chicken flat bread had two pieces of chicken, and our potstickers were sort of Cajun style-- our entrees were horrible. The hubbs ordered the JD Burger which he had no serious complaints about. I had the Fridays shrimp which were not only soggy but tasted like they had been sitting. My daughters ribs-- which the server touted as fall off the bone were hard-- I'm unsure how that happened but they were crispy, I could barely separate them.  We came at noon-- it wasn't busy I don't see how there was no attention to detail. I'm extremely disappointed, and don't believe that I will be returning.

This place is good if you eat from here maybe once every 2 months or more. The food here is so boring, and the menu had only a few selections. I got bored of the place after a few times eating here. I don't think I'd ever come back....... If you do come here and get a heavy hispanic female as your waitress, you should ask to be moved to another table with another waiter or waitress.... I forgot her name, but she was a cold, boring, rude, unfriendly, miserable person. She was terrible the entire night, and she was so fake. It was so bad that I asked another waiter named Mike to get us our check. If you do come here, I suggest you ask for Mike to be your waiter.... overall... awesome dude. He'll take care of you

Absolutely the worst experience. My daughter and I have celiac disease and asked 4 times to 3 different servers that rotated through our table service to ensure our food was prepared as states on the gluten free menu. Lunch arrives and cheese burger is on regular roll. Manager should be personally serving allergy patrons as this could have been a very dangerous outcome. We just stood up and walked out. Gluten free patrons beware!

I have been to a lot of Fridays in the Boston Area and this one is the best. A lot had to do with the server Troy, he was funny and helpful at the same time and was able to make sure that everything went well. If you go to this Fridays ask for Troy he will take care of you.
As soon as we got here our waitress did not even ask us what drink we wanted? They asked us 20 minutes after we sat down. The food is alright but customer service and everything else SUCKKSSSS!
They make an awesome Grateful Dead!!!!  Had a wonderful date night last weekend. The Jack D chicken and Ahi Tuna app is a must have.

Saw the 2 for 20 special so decided to go to try it.  Bad Idea. Worst dining experience ever. Pot stickers were cold, we told the waitress, she came back after 3 minutes with the same plate of pot stickers after reheating it in a microwave...also, one of the pot stickers filling was missing.  We ordered Chicken Burschette and Angus Burger. I think Burger King makes better burger and fries for 1/2 the price. The pasta was disgusting. Chicken tasted like cardboard and pasta was mushy and sauce was tasteless. Never going back again.  This will be my last time going to TGIF.

i am usually a fan of tgi's but tonight was not the best experience.    The place was not busy at all but was told the wait for a table would be 10 mins.   After waiting 20 mins I complained and to their credit we were seated immediately.  Once we had placed  our order we waited 45 mins for the food to arrive.  My husbands order was wrong so again we had to wait until it was taken back and corrected.  We had to ask for silver wear.    We were told the manager would come to speak with us when I complained about the length of time we had to wait for our food but she/he never appeared.
The new Braintree location may be newly renovated, but this location has the nicest, friendliest staff I have ever seen at any restaurant.  It is always a pleasure to visit TGI Friday's in Dedham!

They give you a thousand menus to read and 5 seconds to do it. Waitress was rude that we needed maybe a few more mins. Then we didn't see her for like 20. We ordered those "pick 2 for" deals. We got our appetizers and 5 bites into one of them (not yet,having touched the other one a salad), our dinners came. The person who delivered it got testy when we complained. She said, "well it's not my fault, I can bring it back and keep it under the heat lamps". We said, "No, then it will be all dried out". To make a long story short............we got the waitress to remake one of them and then a manager came by to say." Sorry, please give us a chance to get it right next time". This Company has had about 30 yrs to get it right, this should not happen and he should of made it right then. I was made to feel uncomfortable for complaining and we paid full price. Plus the menus were sticky and the table was too. This place is a joke run by kids and slacker managers.

We did some shopping in Dedham and decided to stop for a bite in TGIF. They seated us in the bar area. It was cold there and VERY noisy, despite the fact it was not that busy there. The woman bartender was very loud, much more than four people that were entertain by her. The waitress that finally stops by to take our order was not very friendly or attentive. We had some orders from 3 for $15 menu plus 2 soups. After waiting for more than 20 min. and freezing, hoping for at least hot soup, we finally got it. My husband had his chicken soup just OK, but I had to return my chowder, as it arrived COLD and so salty, it was not possible to eat. The small sharing dishes ware VERY small, though 2 small skewers of Angus beef were soft and decent. But other two dishes were much to be desired. When we were done, the waitress did not price our food correctly. We were overcharged! At the end she mentioned that the soup I sent back was supposed to be that salty, according to chef in the kitchen. When I said I know what the good taste should be, as I usually order it from many other places, she said: now I understand why you are being so mad...... We do eat out often, but this one is one of the worst we've been in a while. Do yourself a favor: AVOID.

I came here after a movie for some drinks and it was great. The bartender was very friendly and entertaining.  The beer selection was alright.  My girl got a magarita just the way she wanted it and said it was very tasty.  It seemed to have alot of alcohol in it as she was very drunk by the time she finished it.   We did not get any food but the kitchen was still open when we got there. I was plesantly suprised at this place.

I think it's time to break this chain at least the Dedham link. Cold food, gross drinks I mean half filled martini glass that taste gross. The service was terrible. The only people in the place were regular bar folk all drinking beer. Stay away.

We came here for a late dinner after being skeptical about the Chinese place up the road, at least a chain looks a lot less sketchy than that place. We were seated pretty quickly, there was a game going on and the bar was rowdy, which was nice to see a lively place. Our waitress was all sorts of awesome even though she forgot a straw or something minor. I ordered some crazy cocktail that I finished in 5 minutes before our food even arrived. Apparently the pork chop I ordered took the longest to make and made my friends starve with me. Which I was okay with. ;) All in the all, no complaints here, the staff were friendly, the food was great - best pork chop from a chain, I think, and the price is your standard chain price - decent.

Service was very good. Excessive amount of staff for a very slow  Thursday night but they were all polite and friendly. Food was fair - their new mexican salad is typical chain food nothing special. Burgers were good. HOWEVER - the state of the bathrooms was appalling. It was worse then almost any side of the road gas station I've been to. I would NEVER have eaten here if I had seen the state of the bathrooms prior. The smell alone was enough to make my stomach turn...I won't go into details about the rest but I would recommend staying away from this place if the bathroom is any predictor of the cleanliness of the kitchen.

This was a very disappointing experience.  Fast food places serve more palatable food than what we were served.  Our hamburger was cold, the French Fries were cold, the lettuce was wilted and the toasted roll was cold.  It was sent back and the hamburger was returned, not cooked as requested, medium, it was well done and the roll was still cold-but it had been toasted at one time.  The manager was apologetic and took 5.00 off the bill.  I'm not sure how she felt this was compensation.    I suspect all the food at Fridays is precooked and then warmed up.  The chicken on my salad was warm, but dried out on either end and I was unable to cut it with a knife.  Fridays should be ashamed to serve such unacceptable  food.

Overall, I've had good experience. Love their ribs and Fridays' Nachos with the guacamole. Fan of the mojito shaker. However, was there once with a few friends with international IDs, and they didn't accept them for alcoholic drinks. Who carries their passport all the time? Hello, I wouldn't! If it get lost, I would be screwed!

I often come here for drinks with co-workers and the bartenders are always cool, quick and friendly.  They make good drinks and make you feel comfortable.  I've never had the food and doubt I ever will, but if you are looking for a chill night out for drinks, this is a good spot.

My girlfriend and I decided to go to Fridays for dinner. In my opinion the food was decent. Nothing really stood out to catch my attention. Service wise, it was good. The food was quick, however the taste was very bland. The atmosphere of the restaurant was lively. Everyone was talking, laughing, appearing to have a good time. Overall it was decent, but I would not recommend it for a date but a time for the guys.

I tend to have a love-hate relationship with TGI Fridays. But, I was armed with $50 in gift cards from Christmas, so I was ready to give them another try!  First off, the atmosphere leaves me conflicted. I like the pop culture junk all over the walls, and the wacky decor is fine. But, and maybe I'm getting old or something, but do we have to have the music that loud? At lunch? I'd like to enjoy my food with the Killers at a reasonable volume, please.  On to the appetizers! Have to say, I've always liked TGI's apps. We got the potato skins with no bacon (dining with a vegetarian). They were good, tasty even, but for some reason were very salty. Not sure of the reason why, but it threw things off a bit. Luckily, Guy Fereti told me they were half off, so I got more average food for less money!!  Then came redemption. I had the Jack grill combo of steak and shrimp wrapped in bacon. Outstanding. The Jack sauce was sweet and sticky. So so good. The mashed potatoes were a good contrast, and the green beans added some nice crunch and balance.  The service was decent; I did have to ask for a refill once, but no problems with the order or the promptness.  Overall TGI's has always been mediocre for me. However, their Jack Daniels' offerings raise them a bit above the average, and will keep me coming back.

Anyone who reads my reviews knows I have a soft spot for corporate restaurants. Why? Because they're predictable. And sometimes I need the comfort of your standard, everyday chicken fingers and french fries washed down with a larger-than-life Bahama Mama. So for what I'm about to say, don't hold it against me.   I hadn't visited this chain in a long while. So when I was in Dedham wasteland on a rainy Friday night I said why the hell not. My Jack Daniels marinated chicken was just what I bargained for--not great, not bad--with mashed potatoes topped with onion rings. For an appetizer we got tostada nachos with enough weird meat, cheese, and jalapeo to set your anus on fire. Sorry, that was a bit much. For a Friday, as the name implies, the place was packed. People were having fun. At TGI Friday's! Looking around I got the sense that TGI Friday's was the epicenter of these folks' livelihood. But who am I to judge?  Sitting there, I felt like I'd entered a time warp, regressing back to the 90's, being in a high schooler in the South, where chain restaurants are a reason to live for most people. All I needed was my pot dealing boyfriend, his low-rider Honda, and a Lynyrd Skynyrd soundtrack as we skipped the check and headed out to the country for some unprotected sex. In other words, it felt great to be home.
Had the plain Cheese Burger It was Pretty Good Tasty and Cooked Just right!! But I had order for take out cause I was on a time constraint. they said 15 min but was not ready for 30 min.

My husband and I were really strapped for time in Dedham the other day but he really wanted a burger. I didn't want fast food and we had already tried Five Guys. We happened to be stopped at a red light outside of Fridays so we went in. The manager was there to greet us at the door and seat us, which was nice. The waitress was fine. Nothing very special. We got a couple of sodas and a pulled pork sandwich for me and a BBQ burger for him. I can't really describe what it was about my sandwich, but it was so blah I barely ate half. Their "seasoned cajun fries" that were supposed to come with it were just regular fries with a tiny bit of black pepper. The jack daniels sauce that came with it just wasn't my taste. It was really bitter and not very flavorful. I wasn't really expecting much. At most, an adequate lunch. This food disappointed even my very modest expectations. I'll never make that mistake again.

I had the most amazing appetizer here EVER the last time I came. It was fried green beans. So amazing. Probably really bad for me, but they were like the best green beans I've ever had. They came with some crazy wasabi/cucumber dressing that was really good too. I liked them better than I like french fries - which is hard to believe... I have a new found respect for a chain that can become the townies hangout, a place that fries almost anything, and pretty inexpensive, and has the sox on almost 10 screens all around the bar. Totally sweet.

Alright, yes TGI Friday's is obviously a chain, and yes, most chains are alike - but not this one! I've stopped by this Friday's twice over the past couple weeks for a drink at their bar. Not only are the bartenders very social, they'll make sure your beer is full at all times. Attentiveness scores points in my book.

Food was great, but the service could definitely use some improvement. Was hoping to get a quick lunch but it ended up taking about an hour and forty minutes. I asked for a glass of water and only got it a half hour after I was seated.

Every TGI Fridays I've been to I've always enjoyed but this one is the worst. I've came here twice and with no one in front of us I always have to wait to be seated. I look around and there are plenty of areas to be seated at , the floors are always sticky & the waitress' are bland no personality at all &&& never ask how your food is which is a pet peeve of mine. Overall , drinks are good and the food is ok

Very unimpressed with this TGI Fridays, and expectations were not very high to begin with.  Myself and 3 friends came here around 10:30pm for some late night food this past Friday night.  We were met with a 15 min wait for a table, which seemed odd considering it was so late. After being seated, we then waited another 15-20 mins before our server greeted our table. It did not appear to be very busy, except at the bar.  We put in an order for 2 beers and 2 cocktails and also chose to order our food at that point, as well.  Another 15-20 mins goes by, and our drinks have still not arrived.  When they did arrive, my peach sangria tasted like sour mix and peach schnapps.  My friend's blackberry mojito was equally terrible. It appeared that they were extremely short staffed, as our server was bussing tables, but there was no apology for the long wait or any update at any point.  The only saving grace was that our food did not take a lifetime to appear.  The burgers were quite good, but service was just not up to par.

My feelings on this particular Friday's is rather neutral, leaning more towards negative. There was nothing special that would make me want to come back to this specific location. The food I ordered, I can obviously get at any other Friday's or Chili's for that matter. Our waitress was friendly but the service was slow/poor. She would re-visit our table very few times so we would have to wait a while to ask for things like drink refills or the check. Mind you it wasn't a packed house at all. It was dinner time, around 6:30 on a Friday evening. I would have expected there to be a ton of people but was surprised to see not more than 3 or 4 tables (in my area) filled, thus I expected speedier service. On the whole, I wouldn't necessarily cross this place out but if given the option, I might just visit the Chili's or Uno's down the street.
Do not waste your time and money. Food is bland and cold and the service is terrible! I won't be comming back.

While Dinning At Your Location On A Wednesday Night..I Must Say, SERVICE Was Absolutely Out Of Control..The Host Did An AMAZING Job At Accommodating Us..(Party Of 11, No Reservations)..However The Table Service Was Completely A Disaster.. Let's Start With The Server Took A Good 20minutes To Greet Us..I Get She Was Busy, But Management Should Of Been On That..Drinks Took A Good While As Well..I Get We Weren't The Only Party There But There's No Reason..Once The Orders Were Taken & Food Came Out At AGAIN Another Period Of Time, It Was Complete Chaos..We Only Ordered Apps & Thats It..The Runners Didn't Know Where The Food Went..Food Was Also Cold..When I Personally Spoke To Manager I Expressed My Situation & Told Him I Get The Service Because I Myself Work In The Business..He Made Sure Everything Else Ran Smoothly..However Not Sure What He Said To The Server..But She Then Returned To The Table To Carry On Service..It Appears She Had Been Crying..Which In My Book Is A Big NoNo..I Do Not Tolerate When Management Talks Harshly Or Yell At Employees.. Again, It Wasn't Only Her Fault It Was The Whole Restaurant..Together They Are A Team & Due To It Being Slow Season, Management Should Have Been On That..Nonetheless, We Did Tip Her 25% & I Also Spoke To Her Afterwards..Letting Her Know It Wasn't Only Her Fault & For What It's Worth, She Did A Ok Job..Yes I Plan To Visit Again..I Just Hope That They Will Work Better As A Team..

Terrible.  Terrible...  4 bartenders yet we sat and waited and waited for service.  Order the 3 app. Special.  Mozzarella sticks ice cold on the inside. Buffalo chicken still frozen.  Sat at the bar had to ask for bar to be washed off.  Dirty.  Smokers hanging out at front door.  Terrible.

Please stay away from this place! Food is gross ! The service suck!! The girl with the crooked eyeliner was our server, I ordered a strawberry daiquiri with sugar on the rims as it come and garnish with a strawberry. But mine was a rotten strawberry! I care about fresh fruit in my drink because I eat them, so I waved the waiter and told her my strawberry is rotten, she grab the strawberry bare hand and tossed it and did not apologized or offer for another. I order the appetizer combo with 3 choices , the dumpling was undercooked, the glazed chicken bites or poppers or whatever TGIF calls them was burnt! We asked for manager, he came over  , offer for a chance to serve better, its fine. I'll go somewhere else, I'll pay the bill, as leaving he came out with a $25 gift card to T.G.I.F... Lol I gave the gift card to a co-worker for a gift. Lmao

My introduction to TGIF was on my 16th birthday, almost 8 years ago. It was a long and hungry night as I waited for over an hour for my birthday burger to arrive. But bygones be bygones, I reluctantly went back upon the insistance of a co-worker--8 years later to confront my previous conviction to never return.  This time, rather than food, and being of legal age, I tried a Supreme Mojito and a blackberry mojito. A bit over-priced for the contents which were a mediocre mix, I left going "Eh, had better."

my fav place to out and eat..always get the brochette chicken  pasta , flat bread pizza, for $12..u cant beat their prices and the service is always good...would give it a 5 but sometimes the tables are sticky!

Well, I guess its time to turn in my Friday rewards card!  Hubby and I went there on our date nite. (midweek mind you).  Our server Lilly must have been frustrated for some reason unknown to us.  As the saying goes "Actions speak louder than words". That night, she rolled her eyes at us more times than a compulsive gambler rolls the dice in Vegas!  What was her problem?  Hubby didn't see any of this, but I definitely did. I didn't want to ruin our time together so I sucked it up, didn't say anything and decided to write this review.  So it's one star for them.
Service has definitely gone down hill! Server didn't even bring utensils. After the food he never check to see how it was going.

This location is the WORST Friday's I have ever been too. I work in a restaurant and I know what goes on behind the scenes and what it expected of us in how we treat our customers. So when I go to other restaurants I have little to no tolerance of bad service. First thing was that, despite being almost 100% empty, my friend and I still had to wait 10 minutes to be sat. Once we were sat it took another 5 minutes for a waitress to even come to our table and ask for drinks. In my restaurant, we are required to greet customers within 30 seconds of them sitting down..so you can see that 5 minutes felt like an eternity. The waitress finally came and took our drinks and took another 5 minutes to get them back to us. She then took my order and did not write anything down; I asked for a burger with NO cheese. Guess what came back? A burger WITH cheese and it was an expo or busser that brought it to me. I kindly told him that I asked for a burger with no cheese, it was not his fault. Five minutes later, the original waitress came and gave me the burger and did not even apologize. She never asked if I needed a refill..came to check on our table once. Definitely will not be back here again.

This place is ok sometimes, last night i was here and there were people swearing and talking real loud in front of kids, and the managment didnt do anything..the food is good but the environment is not..

My girlfriend and I came to this location the day after a major holiday. The place was almost empty, nothing short of a handful of other customers. The waitress I had gave me the impression that it was a "great inconvenience" for her to do anything for us period. She was even making the "hurry up" motion to collect the menus from us as she disappeared somewhere in the back. The broccoli and cheese soup was cold! How do you serve someone cold soup? The mac and cheese wasn't cheesy at all and guess what? That was cold too! She told me it was "premade" that way. Last but not least, the side of broccoli with my girlfriend's ribs was cold too. I was so disappointed with the service on top of being served with a $67.71 bill. Until this location undergoes a complete overhaul, I would not recommend eating there. If I could rate place this below one star, I would. As an armed forces veteran, the service here is highly unacceptable.

I guess there really isn't a lot to write considering this is a chain restaurant.  However, I will give a brief review with a surprise ending.. I was here this past Saturday night after attempting to hit a couple of places with friends at Legacy place.  Everywhere in Legacy place was a minimum 90 minute wait, place is not that good, so we took off.  We ended up at Friday's in Dedham on Route 1 and went right for the bar area.  It was pretty dead.  It was busy for about 30-40 minutes (this was at 6 PM) and then it died out (which was fine by us). Anyway, once we sat at the bar we waited about 15 minutes to place our drink order.  Bartender made our drinks but didn't ask us if we wanted menus and promptly scattered to the other end of the bar.  This blond bartender was making drinks for the servers and being a total bitch (although later she did improve, we all have off nights I guess)..  Anyway, finally got our menus and ordered got an order of the boneless barbecue bites and they were bland.  I have had them before and they can be quite tasty.  They were almost cold, sauce lacked taste (almost like it was old) and they were just OK (2 out of 5)..  The food?  HORRIBLE..  I got the Parmesan Crusted Chicken, holy crap did it suck.  First of all, the presentation was abysmal.  The chicken was all the way over to the right side of the plate, I went to move the chicken to the middle of the plate, and there were raviolis sandwiched under the chicken.  The Ravioli's were the saddest looking things I have ever seen, if it was a horse it would be shot and put out of it's misery.  The chicken appeared to just have the bread crumbs dumped on it at the last second as they just fell off when you go to take a bite. Chicken was not cooked evenly, so parts of it were almost raw.  The Raviolis? Well, I contemplated eating my Adidas sneaker before these ravioli's.  They were overcooked badly, stuck together, no taste at all, just gross. Cooks in this place clearly don't care.  My Brother got a burger, WAY overcooked..  I didn't get in to how my friend's things were but they didn't say anything awful so I would have to say they felt their meals were OK (although based on the pathetic experience I had, as well as my Brother's burger, I can not say that with 100% accuracy).. I realize this is a chain place, I know that going in, I don't expect much but did at least expect decent food (even mediocre), it's what I completely expect, they couldn't even accomplish that.   The surprise (drum roll....) I know you are all DYING for it, it is GOOD..  Girlfriend is enjoying her Blue Moon, then (continue drum roll)....  GLASS in her mouth! wohoo!! are you kidding?? Glass must have broken in to the ice bin where the frosty mugs are and no one did anything about it.  NOW to Friday's CREDIT, the blond (who I said was being a bitch) was very attentive, got her a new beer immediately and took the piece of glass to the manager.  The manager instantly came over, apologized, took her drinks (which there had been many) completely off the bill and gave her 5 FREE appetizer cards for any Friday locations.  Manger was VERY polite.  However, they did NOT change the glasses out of the bin where her glass had been pulled from (BIG no no) but it was our last drink and we bolted for the night.   Only go here if you are dying of starvation, would recommend it for drinks with friends (as long as you don't get a hunk of glass in your mouth from your beer mug)..

I would rate -1, if I had a choice. Specially to the manager who didn't came as we waited for food over 50 min. Even when we said, manager attitude was get rid of them. II don't write review, today I thought I should. This happened on Monday Feb, 17, 2014 , 12:40 pm. I don't how the food have been after 2 hours , may be better than McDonald's food, but I doubt that.

I feel like TGI Fridays is one of the few  chain places i go to just because I have no where else to go...so I might as well come. Well, the food was not that great, and the price is icky. The only redeeming part about this place is the brownie obsession dessert. It's BOMB.

Service is subpar, the Brushetta Chicken Pasta floats in oil, the chicken is flat and bland. My dining partner's chicken fingers were so undercooked looking, they looked blonde in color instead of the golden brown they should've been. The booth was sticky and we had to ask for it to be wiped down. Will not return to this location.
Slow service, bored and indifferent waitress and hostess, food lukewarm, small portions, bar patrons are like a cross between a Ramada Inn and a biker bar.

Dirty.... Bad burnt food... racist and unprofessional staff and "Managers"... and a complete waste of time... TGI Fridays used to be a place I enjoyed, now it's a complete disgrace and disappointment!!!

Reader do you want to know my favorite restaurant?  Well it is T.G.I.Fridays . I love going there with my family because we love the food, the atmosphere, and the games.  When you get the menu the prices are really low so you don't have to pay a lot of money for delicious food. If you think that's good, wait until you hear about the food . At T.G.I.Fridays they have lots different food types of food on the menu . My favorite food on the menu are their hot ribs, juicy burgers and soft fries. They also have lots of drinks too.  There is a variety of sodas, juices, slushies, and frozen drinks. My favorite is the blue raspberry coolatta. Now if you think this is my last reason, it is not. The atmosphere is funky. The decoration is so cool. The art on the walls are so artistic and creative. I like how people can listen to music while eating. You can also watch tv while you wait to place your order. When someone comes in the door the light always flashes. Do you like to be entertained? Well they have fun games to play. They have a pool table, video games, and an hockey air table. My favorite game is the hockey air table because the puck moves on air and when someone scores a goal you get a point. 10 points move you to next round.  T.G.I.Fridays is the best restaurant. You and your family can make it fun. They have affordable food that tastes great. The decorations are cool and they have games for all ages to play. I'm sure you'll love it as much as my family and I does.   - Written by Danielle, a third grader at the BTU School

Great for lunch. Our server was friendly and attentive. She explained if we hadn't been here in a while, some menu items have changed but really some menu items were just reintroduced. He ordered the shrimp with fries and I ordered the ribs with shrimp . Hot and crispy fries , coleslaw on point not to soggy, overall great food fast service and friendly server. Will come again to this TGIF.

Came here on a Friday night. The place was empty and we still had to wait 10 minuets to be seated. It took our waiter over 20 minuets to acknowledge. I had to stand up and waive for service. When we finally ordered our appetizers, they came out cold. I had to walk to the kitchen to notify a staff member! I even had to go to the bar to get a refill on my beverage after I grew impatient of waiting. The place is definitely understaffed. I will not come back a second time. I would recommend going to Uno's down the street. I got the grilled chicken, it was okay considering had the lowest calorie count (420 cals). The steamed vegetables that come with the meal have no seasoning or anything. My plate was not even warm! The sizzling chicken shrimp was anything but sizzling. The chicken is bland and dry. The bbq chicken salad was iffy. When compared to the same salad you get at Cheesecake Factory, it's a joke. I made it a point to try it and looks more appealing than it tastes. Don't waste your calories on it. There is a first time for everything! I would not consider trying this location out. The fries that came with the chicken tenderers tasted salted cardboard. I am utterly dissatisfied with my meal, waitress, and the atmosphere.

This was the second and last time that we will eat here. If I were to say that the host and waitress were unfriendly, that would be an understatement. They hardly made eye contact with us and could have cared less about giving us good service. My husband and I went for the endless apps, and we waited probably at minimum 10 minutes per app to come out. After the second set of apps came out, our waitress started walking away without even asking if we wanted to order more (they are endless, remember). Each time after that we had to flag her down. She not once asked if we wanted refills on our drinks. It took us about 2 hours to eat 5 sets of apps because the wait time was so long between both service and food and FYI, it was not busy in there.

This place is nasty, please save your money. I got my drink in a dirty glass. Wait stuff are rude and don't want to be there, management isn't any better. The bathroom floor is sticky, nasty and stinky. And the wait is ridiculous, I called to get a table I was told 15 minutes I told them I will be there in 20 minutes okay got there and still had to wait. Got our table 30 minutes later they brought our drinks in a dirty class food plate look like the put it in a someone's else's left over plate. I ordered traditional buffalo wings why did my plate had boneless wings in the bottom with BBQ sauce on my plate instead of buffalo. I ask for my pretzel unsalted salt all over the plates. Glass being thrown at wait stuff so lots of broken glasses. This place is trash.

I'm going to start with giving this restaurant 0 stars.  Arrived to music so loud I couldn't keep a simple conversation with my dinner date  We couldn't hear each other!  Than after a almost 20min wait our server came and as I began my order she got bothered about my order saying they no longer carry what I ordered, so she removed the old menu (which in fact was badly soiled) and proceeded to walk away.  The food was badly cooked,  parts over cooked other part under cooked. Loose loose situation.   Complained to Manger, she was very apologetic,  removed the meal from bill. Moral of this experience it being the second time for us,   NEVER GOING BACK !!

I love TGI but the service at this location sucks. Sat at the bar for 10 minutes and the bartender served people who sat after us. Didn't acknowledge us until I said "Excuse me, do you service this side of the bar?"  He finally grabbed us menus. After that, he left and was nowhere to be found to take our orders. Needless to say, we got up and left.

This place sucks...worse of the chain...all I wanted was quick drink and be out..took forever to seat us ...didn't have any space at bar nor clean table in lounge area ...when seated waitress took forever to realize we were there... table was in scrambles ..waitress all over the place ..lost someone's credit card...and screamed out did anyone find it...didn't get first drink till well after last call ..couldn't get another even tho we was there in time for a few.. Food was rushed...waitress avoided us...

Reserved 7:15 pm on open table. Showed up on time, but didn't get seated until 7:30 pm after they said it was only going to be a 1 minute wait. Sat at the booth with my family and no waiter for 15 minutes. Not even to get out beverages or even greet us. We decided to walk out. It was just so unorganized from the time I stepped into the restaurant until the time I got up and left. We had another event to attend after dinner but obviously we had no dinner and of course we made it to our next event. It was sloppy work. Even the guy who walked us to our booth didn't seem like he knew what was going on. He walked us all over the restaurant to seat us. Definitely under staff and even the staff that were on the clock were very unprofessional. First and last time back!

Took my grandson here for dinner after a long absence. Used to love this place, but WOW has a lot changed! At 5:30 there were very few customers, yet the service was slooow. The wait staff was indifferent at best, and acted as though they wanted to be anyplace but there. Grandson's fries and my soup (french onion, and I had to cut the cheese--or maybe the bread, I couldn't tell what it was--with a knife, and it was still rock-hard) were cold.  I had to go hunting for a ketchup bottle with anything in it (most I checked were all but empty) after waiting almost ten minutes for a replacement. Waitress NEVER came to see if we needed anything, I had to go hang around the kitchen until I saw her. Finally while waiting for grandson's dessert I told her to forget it and bring the check. YIKES. I will NEVER go there again. Too bad, used to be a good reliable spot for a decent meal. And oh yes, the bathroom was FILTHY.

First I would like to say I work in the industry so it's hard for me to be overly critical of a restaurant because I know that some factors are out of the control of the staff but I just didn't have positive experience here. I ordered the brunch steak& eggs, and waited 18 minutes on a slow Sunday. My eggs were missing so that added another 12 minutes and my steak was over cooked. The manager to his credit remade my whole plate, but forgot my toast. I was starving so I just ate. I will give them two stars because the were polite, but other than that I learned my lesson.... never order anything that requires a temperature.

Absolutely gross!  I should have known better. Parking lot empty at 12:30 on a Beautiful Thursday.  Upon entering, the floor was sticky.  We were seated at a booth near the bar.  SCREAMING toddler in the booth next to us. She was running up and down towards the bathrooms!  DANGEROUS!  Top that off with loud bar blender nearby!  Chicken in chicken Caesar salad was tough and chewy and who puts the root end piece of romaine in the salad? Sweet potato fries tasteless.  Over priced unimpressive passion fruit(?) iced tea. Don't think I'll ever go to a TGIFridays again!  Just a bad experience.  Go to Joe's American Bar across the street instead!

Plan and simple dont waste your money and time here waiters suck service stinks and dont let me get started on if you have any allergys to anything dont bother telling them they wont pay attention  food was ok from 1to 10 ill say a 7..... sorry but i wont be coming here again.
Emma makes the best mudslides and under pressure, remains super sweet and provides excellent customer service. Thank you!!!!

Didn't even make it to the meal. Entered asking the wait time and was told "Long, so long!" Headed to the bathroom to kill time, passed several empty tables and lots of wait staff standing around. Bathroom was filthy. Walked out.

Took my 5 year old daughter out after her starting kindergarten this week. She wanted pasta and although the Friday's isn't where I would normally go for pasta I hadn't been in a while. Our server Xavier was amazing and the food came so fast I forgot how long we were sitting there. My daughter had the half size entree of the Bruschetta pasta and I had the Chipotle Yucatan Chicken Salad which were amazing. Love this place and tonight was no disappointment especially with the efficiency of our server Xavier.

A friend and i went to this location last night to sit at the bar and have a few apps and drinks. We were greated promptly .. Which was great! But thats all we got. we sat with empty glasses in front of us every single time. We had to flag down the bartender and ask for drinks every time. The bar was dead! There was maybe 4 other parties.. This was the worst experience ive ever had at a bar. We were so annoyed we left and went elsewhere. The male bartender was way more interested on doing flair And sidework rather than asking of we wanted another drink. The female bartender was miserable. Not a smile or interaction in anyway. During our visit a patron ( whom im asuming was an employee) got up from her table and went behind the bar and started making her own drink.. Which she shared w the female bartender. We sat there and watched this woman make herself a drink while we had empty drinks. Awful experience and will not be going back.

Awful. Just awful service all around. The service was so shitty that we left before even getting served our drinks . Which still had not happened after almost 30 minutes sitting at the table. What a disaster, I don't know how they're still open for business

This is the absolute worst place to eat. On numerous occasions I've gone here and the service is always horrid and the food is never cooked the way you'd like. The only time you'll see your waiter is when you're ordering your food and when you get your food. Go to unos down the street instead.
